dialogues.text: John steps out of his car and the puppy, now twice the si he was three weeks ago, bounds over to him. A harried Lor follows, a rope leash and instruction. sheet in hand. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! He got big... This is the right one, right? LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see him pack away the puppy chow. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what if I run into any problems? LORI (BACKING AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sure, call me. All sales are final, though. Not just for him. I tell that to everyone. (QUICKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want help getting him in the car? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay, I'll just... John opens the door, indicates that Marley should jump in Instead, the puppy runs around the car, barking, jumping on the bumpers. John finally catches him, lifts him up, p him on the front passenger seat atop some towels. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go. (TURNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, anyway, thanks for-- But Lori's already inside her house, the door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and the puppy on the drive home. The puppy atop a pi of towels. John looks at him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... guy. The dog just stares at him quizzically. Uncomfortable alo with the dog, John turns on the radio. BOB MARLEY plays a the puppy THUMPS HIS TAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Bob Marley? The dog THUMPS HIS TAIL AGAIN. John turns up the music. THUMP. THUMP. THUMP faster this time. JOHN (CONT'D) GOOD BOY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying it out) Bob? (nothing, then) Marley. THUMP THUMP THUMP. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley. Okay-- Marley. Cool. But now the pup starts wriggling towards John, John tries put him back... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- stay boy... stay. (the dog crawls into his lap) Okay, not really safe, bud-- Marley gets stuck with half his body draped over the cons He remains like this, his tail thumping... John gives up. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, fine, but just this time. THUMP. THUMP. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: door. The dog John pulls up in the driveway and opens the jumps out. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our house... The dog immediately pees on the ground. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's yours. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John crouches down, shows him his bowls... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's water. This one's food.
26 CONTINUED: 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley starts pawing the food bag. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, you've already had kibble and half a seat belt. (moment, relents) All right. Special treat. But just today... He opens the bag and Marley tackles it. Several cupfuls spill onto the floor. John goes to the pantry to get the dustpan and brush. When he returns, he finds Marley has eaten the food in the bowl AND every last scrap of spille food. And now he's squatting to pee again... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no! He picks up the puppy and rushes him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John sets him down on the ground, steps back. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now. Pee. He motions with his zipper. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, do your thing. (Marley just stares) Alright, I'm gonna show you this one time... From behind, we see John peeing. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except you gotta lift your leg. (lifts his leg) See, this is how you guys do it... Marley looks at him, squats and pees... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could do it like that. Just not in front of other guy dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's on the phone. Her young NIECE and NEPHEW wait for her, a board game on the floor between them. She motions that she'll just be a second...
28 28 CONTINUED: JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley. I like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's on the phone, talking to Jenny as he follows Marle around the room, trying to keep shoes and socks and cords of his mouth... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Because it can be temporary... INTERCUTTING: JOHN & JENNY JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's good. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be exhausted. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, he's pooped. Marley lets out a SQUEAK as he tugs at a couch cushion... JENNY (HEARS IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he sounds so sweet! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (snapping his fingers at the dog, shaking his head "no") He's very cute. Just like a little kid only furrier. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the phone by his ear... John chases after the dog who burrows under the couch, hi tail sticking out so that John can't get him... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, okay, he's listening. John just holds the phone awkwardly as Jenny coos baby ta JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hey, Marley! Who's my good boy?! Mommy can't wait to meet you...
29 29 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, don't worry, he's doing great. Like he's lived here his whole life. All eight weeks of it. And you know what else? I think he's going to be pretty easy to train. I mean, he's curious which means he's smart, right? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he is. I can't wait to see him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just him? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jealous? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one sleeping in a box. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I'll see you Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, dressed to go out, is setting down Marley in his wo box on the garage floor. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you in the morning, okay? Marley looks at him with a heartbreaking expression. John hesitates. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come on, don't. You'll be fine, alright. And tomorrow, we're gonna tear it up. I'm thinking kibble, park, chew toy, the whole nine yards. Okay? we good? Marley doesn't-look so good, looks kind of sad. John turn and gets out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets into his car. He can hear WHIMPERING. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big day tomorrow! Rest up, pal! He listens a beat; Marley quiets down. He gets in his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Journalist hang out.'John and Sebastian at the bar. Many Sebastian, he's constantly nodding at people throughout: SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm there in this cave, right? Blindfolded. And I can feel the machine guns, there's like nine of 'em around me... and they tie me to a chair and then Escobar comes in and says-- are you ready? (SPANISH ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read your piece on Kadahfi, And I think you captured his narcissism just right. (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe that? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I wish you could've been there. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but then I wouldn't have been able to do the piece on the water main break at the library. That would have sucked. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand on John's shoulder) Your time will come, amigo. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink to that-- They toast with their beers, Sebastian clocks John lookin his watch. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be somewhere? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. No, it's the puppy. It's his first NIGHT ALONE-- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got adoc?
32 32 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley. A little lab. Like you said. Remember? The bomb... SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Smart move. You'll see. (slaps him on the back) You've just preserved your quiet way of life for at least another two years. 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls up, gets out of his car. Halfway down the bloc we see a POLICE CAR, lights flashing, two OFFICERS talkin a COUPLE. Another NEIGHBOR, in his robe, stands in the street watching... NEIGHBOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millers got robbed again. (then, turns to John) And that mutt of yours hasn't shut up since you left. John looks towards the garage where we hear WHIMPERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and the puppy gets excited-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no... I just wanted you to know I'm back. The puppy whimpers and he goes over to him, reaches into box and pets him... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, you really gotta chill, okay? Yeah, I know, good to see you, too. But I'm just inside the house, I'll see you in the morning. Big day tomorrow. Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gulps orange juice from the bottle. Leaves a quarter inch, puts it back in the fridge. And now we hear BARKING from the Garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water running. John swallows some preventative aspirin, picks some nachos off his shirt. He turns off the water. And we hear WAILING and KEENING coming from the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John has his head buried under the pillows AS THE WAILING KEENING GO ON. AND ON. AND ON. Finally, John can't take i anymore. He sits up, pulls earplugs out of his ears. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light comes on and Marley's head appears over the of the box. John sighs, comes over and scoops him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets Marley settled in the box, now by the side of t bed. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this one time. John climbs into bed, shuts off the light. Marley whimper and John rolls onto his stomach, reaches into the box and strokes his back, the puppy lays down, still whimpers... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on... (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Remember this? (half drunk, sings badly) One love, one heart... (MARLEY QUIETS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get together and feel alright... John nods off, one arm hanging over the side of the bed i the box, his hand resting on Marley's back as the puppy n snoozes peacefully and we then... FADE OUT. AN ALARM CLOCK SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Tail rising in the b.g., wagging.
40 40 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John opens his eyes to see Marley snuggled up against face. Marley's eyes looking into his. John reaches over t puppy and shuts off the alarm. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes home today. Hung over, he sits up, looks around the messy room, half to John's bachelor housekeeping habits, half due to Marle Not only has everything has been chewed, but some time du the night Marley discovered how much fun toilet paper is. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should probably clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John vacuums, struggles to empty the bag, puts a broken v in the trash, does the dishes, etc. Marley follows him, t wreaking havoc, knocking over everything that isn't naile down. John picks up the HUGE CHEW TOY he'd just bought an examines it as Marley runs into the bathroom... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. It's already completely gnawed up. John looks at Marley w emerges dragging a roll of toilet paper, rams right into screen door, bounces back. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, it's a screen, you're not gonna GET THROUGH--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Marley backs up a few steps, gets a head of st then rams into it again, this time goes right through it. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets drenched as he gives Marley a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drags Marley into the garage. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in an hour. Be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit of THUNDER as John comes out with a bag of grocerie and a bunch of flowers. He gets to the car just as the ra hits. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John and Jenny kiss outside the terminal. She holds a stuffed "Pluto." JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my puppy? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. A little tired, but OTHERWISE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nudges him. He gives her another kiss. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jenny get out of the car. We hear WHIMPERING in garage. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley! She takes off for the side door of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the door and freeze. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. It's a mess. It's almost incredible that it's all due to single puppy. The box is in shreds; so are the blankets. puddle of urine on the floor. A large piece of dry wall h been chewed off near the big garage door. The garbage can are overturned. Marley is whimpering in the corner. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay, this is not how I left it. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has he been in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3ГўВЂВў/06/07 30. 47 CONTINUED: 47 JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour, at the most. (looks around, then) Jeez... he Alg drywall. That's just not right. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she picks him up) Look. He's shaking-- Another bit of THUNDER and the puppy whimpers louder. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does thunder scare you, Mister? Hm? He licks her face, snuggles into her. She gives him the Pluto stuffed animal. She hugs him... JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at us. She looks up at John and smiles. He returns the smile. Mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marley bursts out of the back bedroom with one of Jenn bras in his mouth. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, no! Jenny chases him into the kitchen, past John who holds up newspaper... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me an extra paragraph... Marley bursts through the back screen door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seemingly continuous shot, except that it's now A SIX M OLD MARLEY who comes through the screen into the backyard clutching a set of curtains in his mouth, still attached the rod, and it's now JOHN who stumbles through the broke wire mesh to chase after him... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, no! John chases him across the backyard. Marley goes under th fence and John starts to go over into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now it's a NINE MONTH OLD MARLEY who comes up from un the fence clutching a THANKSGIVING TURKEY in his mouth. A now it's Jenny AND John who go over the fence chasing him JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, no! They wave to the NEIGHBOR standing on his patio watching. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tom-- Sorry... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Thanksgiving... Marley goes through a hedge and out onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Marley emerges into FRAME a FULL GROWN DOG, rapidly pulling Jenny by the leash along the intercoastal waterwa We track with him until a WOMAN WALKING A POODLE IS NOW I FRAME and Marley gets the two women entangled as he start humping the smaller dog... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, no! 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits across from Arnie. He looks thrown: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, why me? ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a bind, John. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm a reporter, not a columnist. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a step up. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's a step away from what I wanna do. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's also better pay, you set your own hours, pick your own topics... (MORE)
52 52 CONTINUED: ARNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and it's only temporary, just until I find someone permanent. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Jerry? ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have noticed that in every other column, he went on about The Pie Palace? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really haven't read his-- ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out he's been getting free meals in exchange for mentioning the joint. It's also why he became such a fat ass. John nods. Oh. ARNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it's twice a week. And like I said, it's only until I can find someone else to replace him. Then you're back on, uh... whatever beat you were on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls up, gets out of the car. His neighbors, The year-old GIRL -- short blue hair, pierced eyebrow -- and MOM -- in a nurses uniform -- unload groceries from the c GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dog's funny. JOHN (PAUSES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to eat one of our tires. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, dogs need rubber. Little known fact, helps the digestive tract... GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Along with the occasional black Converse high top which I'd still love to get back by the way.
53 53 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Preciate that. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits at the table scribbling on a legal pad. He tear off the sheet and crumples it up, throws it across the ro Marley bounds into the room, Jenny behind him, sweating. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he dislocated my shoulder. He doesn't heel-- hell, he doesn't even walk, he sprints, and I had to pull him off three dogs... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poodle? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, among others. There was a Yorkie, a Dalmatian and a bichon frise that may never be right again. (sees the legal pad) What're you doing? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie gave me a column. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding? Congratulations! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, it's a big honor. I get to write about zoning laws and yard sales. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you make something out of it. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only temporary until he finds someone else. I'm just trying to get something down for Tuesday. She gives him a kiss, starts out of the room JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll think of something. And John, I'm serious abut Marley. He wreaks havoc everywhere he goes. We gotta do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. KORNBLUT, weathered and stern, is studying John. Behi John, eight puppies and their owners are chatting before class begins.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Incorrigible? I don't believe in that. All dogs want to learn. But they can't when their owners are weak-willed. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very strong-willed.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: And where is your animal? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's over there. With my wife. He was a little excited. He usually needs a little time to calm down. Ms. Kornblut looks at Jenny as she struggles up with Marl

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: I see. He calls the shots. Which of you will be the trainer? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we thought we both would, since we want him to listen to both of us at home -

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: A dog can only answer to one master. Which one of you has the most natural authority in your own relationship? JOHN (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll watch.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: I thought so. We begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ms. Kornblut gestures, demonstrates the command:

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Sit!
56 56 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students order their dogs to sit, and most of them do The ones that don't require only a little effort to get t idea. Whereas: Jenny orders Marley to sit; instead Marley jumps up on he and puts his paws on her shoulders. She presses his butt the ground, and he rolls over for a belly rub. She tries tug him into place and he grabs the leash in his teeth, shaking it playfully.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That, class, is an example of a dog that has been foolishly allowed to believe he is the alpha male of his pack. And therefore he cannot be a happy animal. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the sidelines) Yeah, he looks really bummed. Kornblut hears him, death stares John.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: You. Joker. Rotate in. John looks at Jenny who shrugs, holds up the leash for hi take.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: As Ms. Kornblut demonstrates on her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: The choke chain. When your animal walks properly by your side, there'll be slack. If he pulls, it tightens around his neck like a noose and loosens as soon as he stops pulling. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt them?

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Well, it's not called a hug chain. But they learn to like it. Go on, collar your dogs. Everyone else quickly, easily gets the choke chain around their dogs' necks. Of course. Meanwhile: John kneels down and struggles to put it. around Marley's neck. Marley, liking its shiny jingling, tries to eat it.
57 CONTINUED: 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much tussling, and John finally gets it around Marley's n but Marley still manages to grab it in his teeth. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: That's because he's eating it... Get it out of his mouth. Class? Give your dogs the sit command. All the dogs sit; John forces Marley's butt down.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The leash is held in two places. Loop around your right hand, left hand at waist level. Dog always on your left, of course. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means us, pal. He rearranges Marley so he's on John's left.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Now, when you give the heel command, step off with your left foot - I don't want to see any right foot first steppers - and walk. If your dog gets ahead, administer a correction by forcefully bring your left hand down and towards the right, and he'll respond. Shall we? One, two, three - now! Just as the dogs and owners prepare to step off, Marley lurches ahead of the pack... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley, heel! Marley takes off like a fighter jet, dragging John behind

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Correct him! John gives a mighty yank on the leash. Marley coughs, hesitates. John loosens the leash - and Marley explodes forward again. John yanks, Marley stops, John releases, Marley explodes forward.
57 CONTINUED: (2) 57

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rein in that dog! All right, everyone, line up again. Demonstration. Mr. Grogan? Pay attention. She takes the leash from John and efficiently guides him line with the other dogs.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a simple question of confidence in one's own authority. Shall I demonstrate a simple walk? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT
dialogues.text: Class? Even an unruly dog wants to obey his leader. Marley? Heel. And she steps off confidently - but Marley is a bit more confident than she is. He lunges, she pulls, he falls bac on his hind legs, then barrels up and lurches forward. Ms. Kornblut half-stumbles, half rockets across the park. She manages to turn Marley around, and the whole process begins again as they make their way back to the line. Her face is flushed with embarrassment, anger, and exertion, Marley, jowls frothing, is having a ball. It's like a walking tug-of-war. With difficulty, Ms. Kornblut manages to return Marley to John, but not before, as a coup-de-grace, he starts humpi her leg enthusiastically. She struggles, he knocks her do and then he buries his face in her crotch and humps her k John and Jenny rush over. John restrains Marley; Jenny he up Mrs. Kornblut. She's livid.

dialogues.speaker: MS. KORNBLUT, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Shhhhh... hang on... She listens for a moment with a little microphone hooked to a speaker. Nothing. NURSE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Monday, yes. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be a little early for that. Let's go right to the sonogram. Did you bring your blank tape? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving it, smiling) Ready to roll. NURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a good picture first. It'll be on the monitor there. The Nurse begins running the instrument around Jenny's stomach. John and Jenny peer at the computer screen. NURSE (CONT'D) (NEUTRAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. This one doesn't seem to be picking up anything. Excuse me, I'll be just a minute... She leaves. Jenny and John smile at each other, but insid each of them, a small pinpoint of fear starts to expand. wait for a few moments. A pressured silence. And then... smiles down at DR. SHERMAN comes in, followed by the nurse, Jenny.

dialogues.text: Hi, guys. Let's have a look at your baby, shall we? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting Draft  57. MARLEY & HE 80 80 CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he takes the instrument) All right, there we go. Good. Now, look over there. Much better resolution, right? Jenny and John, holding hands, look at the computer scree They see a sac, which, with a click of the mouse, Dr. She expands and expands. But it's empty. Jenny tries to smile JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything in there?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Not what you'd expect to see at ten weeks. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite ten weeks. Dr. Sherman looks at them directly. Kindly:

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Jenny, I'm sorry, but there's no heartbeat. John and Jenny are still, silent.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One in six pregnancies ends this way. it just happens sometimes, that's all. I'm very sorry. But you're young and healthy and in a couple of months, you can try again. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come by my office on your way out and we can talk some more. He exits. John is still holding the blank videotape. He tries to hide it from Jenny. He leaves. Jenny and John lo at each other. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this happen? What'd I do wrong? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have. Otherwise, how could I lose it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 80 CONTINUED: (3) JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, it's not something you have any control over. It's like the doctor said, it just happens-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me... I did something wrong. I know it... I did something wrong. I'm sorry, John... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am-- I'm sorry-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need sorry. You didn't do anything! She turns away and begins to cry. John just sits there, staring at the videotape in his hands. Outside in the hall, the door to another examining room o and they hear a couple laughing, talking excitedly. Jenny and John look away from each other, their pain made even worse. 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is driving Jenny home. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a couple of months, we can try again. Okay? Jenny just looks out the window. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John helps Jenny through the kitchen door. Marley follows them, circles them wildly, then stops, puzzled, as he loo at them. Jenny goes into the living room; Marley follows her. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some tea? (NO ANSWER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what I was thinking? We still have those tickets from your parents for the honeymoon in Ireland. We can finally do that. (MORE)
82 CONTINUED: 82 JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some time off. It'll be fun, clear our heads, right? (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny? No answer. He goes into the living room and stops cold: JOHN'S POV - JENNY & MARLEY Jenny sits on the couch. Marley stands at her feet, with shoulders between her knees, his big head resting in her His tail hangs flat between his legs. His eyes are turned at her, and he whimpers softly. Jenny strokes his head a few times and then, with no warn buries her face in the thick fur of his neck and begins sobbing. They stay like that for a moment, Marley statue- still, Jenny clutching him to her like an oversized doll. John stands there, watching Marley take care of her. No words, just being there. A lesson here. Her head down, Jenny raises one arm up towards John and John goes to the couch and wraps his arms around both of them. We then... FADE OUT.

dialogues.text: Oh. He's... big.

dialogues.text: Yeah. Close to a hundred pounds. (re: the leash struggle) He just wants to say hi. He won't hurt you. Just stand still and be calm. You're a dog person, right? DEBBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: well, actually - JOHN

dialogues.text: - Ready? DEBBY

They kiss him goodbye. Get in the cab and go. Debby runs Marley, grabs his leash and struggles with all her might hold on to Marley. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach. But this is 1991, and the planes fly half-full. Jo N

dialogues.text: There are just a few things about Marley you need to know. He eats three times a day. If he looks starved, feed him again. Of course all this food has to go somewhere. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the red shovel and the blue bucket. Watch your step. Don't worry about the color. He likes mangoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley & He Shooting Draft  61. 87

dialogues.text: John and Jenny enjoy the scenery. Sheep in the road surro their car. Jenny leans out, laughing, and takes a picture JENNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley's ears get a lot of wax buildup. Once or twice while we're gone, please use cotton balls and the blue ear- cleaning stuff to clean them out. Wear old clothes and try not to breathe. 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debby is throwing up in her mouth a little as she cleans Marley's ears. Marley loves it. JENNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley is an excellent watchdog. And in this neighborhood, that's a good thing. You can rest easy at night, knowing he's on the job. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debby, ears plugged, shades over her eyes, weeps in frustration as Marley HOWLS at the moon. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jenny stop at a bed-and-breakfast for the night. It's raining softly. JENNY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunderstorms are his weak point. Well, one of his weak points. You can give him sedatives if you think a storm is arriving. He doesn't like them, so push them down into his throat as far as they go. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBY IS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: 92 INT. IRISH B & B - NIGHT An Irish widow, MRS. BUTTERLY, leads them to their room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley & He Shooting Draft  62. 92 CONTINUED: 92 JOHN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do not allow Marley to get up on any piece of furniture, chew on anything except his toys, drink out of the toilet - keep the lid closed and the brick on the lid - 93

dialogues.text: Debby is showering - and then starts SCREAMING. Marley ha stuck his head through the shower curtain and is licking water. Debby splashes water at him to make him go away. Marley, thinking she's playing, scrambles into the tub wi her. She grabs the curtain, and it pops off the curtain rings one by one as in ",Psycho." JOHN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - actually, you might want to keep the bathroom door closed in general. 94

dialogues.text: Debby has run out of the bathroom, a towel hastily wrappe around her. Marley chases her. He leaps - and returns to earth with the towel in his mouth. Debby SCREAMS. 95

dialogues.text: Debby is standing on a coffee table, nude, swatting at an unseen Marley with a bunch of tall artificial flowers. JOHN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than that, enjoy him! Thanks so much. Love, Jenny and John. 96

dialogues.text: Four walls, four different floral wallpapers. Twin beds. Above one, the Sacred Heart of Jesus. Above the other, th Sacred Heart of Mary. Crucifixes everywhere you look, and HUGE framed picture of Pope John XXIII.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BUTTERLY
dialogues.text: And if you need anything during the night, I'm right next door. The blankets are wool. Good heat in them. JENNY

dialogues.text: Oh, they're electric?

dialogues.text: No, not in this house. My brother died in a fire, God rest him. (MORE)
96 96 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BUTTERLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In this room, actually. It's been re- papered. Good night. God bless. Jenny sits on the bed. The CREAKING is terrible. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know we haven't had sex since... you know. But there's no way we're breaking the streak tonight. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. 'Cause it's not just God watching. God, his mother... (indicating next door) .and apparently his best friend. 97

dialogues.text: They are in separate beds, staring at the crucifix. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's July, but I think I can see my breath. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel my toes. John gets out of his bed and into Jenny's. Much SQUEAKING JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. Shhh. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

A THIRD B & B - NIGHT 100 Jenny sits on the bed, smiles at the NOISE, starts taking her shoes. John ushers the Owner out of the room.

dialogues.text: John and Jenny pull into the driveway. They see Debby, th house sitter, on the front steps with her bag packed. She tired-looking, beat. She reaches for a pair of crutches. John gets out of his car, a smile on his face. JOHN

dialogues.text: Hey, Debby. So how was-- -Debby hurls the binder of instructions at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And those goddamned dog tranquilizers don't work! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: (as she gets in the car) And just so you know, I am a dog person. But that's not a dog! That's evil with a dog face! That's also humping your leg! Lose my number!! And she gets into her car and guns it, splintering the crutches as she peels out. John and Jenny, watch her go, turn and look at the front door. Marley's face in the lit square window at the top, peeking out at them.

dialogues.text: A THUNDERSTORM outside. John sits at his desk, tries to w while Marley walks in circles. John looks at him... JOHN

dialogues.text: John and Jenny are asleep. Marley goes through his nightt ROUTINE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chews through a sock. He drinks out of the toilet. He works on chewing through the plastic dog food tub. Anothe night and he'll be in. He chases a fly. Finally he goes to his bed on the floor of the bedroom. H settles himself down to sleep. He yawns, he scratches, he closes his eyes. He snores. And then - He wakes up, suddenly alert. He looks over at Jenny. He gets up, sits by her side of the bed, and waits. Suddenly Jenny sits up, rests a hand on her stomach. JENNY WHOA--

dialogues.text: She catches her breath, leans over to John. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: John. John, wake up. JOHN

dialogues.text: What? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time.

dialogues.text: Jenny has finished dressing. Suddenly she yelps in pain, doubles over. John takes her in his arms. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Suddenly, A GROWL. They turn to see Marley glaring at Joh JOHN

dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm not hurting her. Jenny MOANS again and now Marley's eyes narrow. He takes step towards John. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Please don't scream, honey. He'll kill me. JENNY

dialogues.text: Like I'd forget that.

dialogues.text: Panicking, John is struggling to get the car seat he forg out of the box. He starts beating at the Styrofoam. Marle barks excitedly. John gets an idea, hands him one end of box. JOHN

dialogues.text: Come on, Marley. Help me out here. Do what you do best... Unsure, Marley licks the box. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't lick it, eat it! Destroy it! You can chew through drywall, man! I know you can do this! Marley catches on. He starts shredding the box.

dialogues.text: John hurls a suitcase and the partially-assembled, partia destroyed car seat into the back seat. He yells: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here... Stay. Be good. Please, God. No storms. Stay.

dialogues.text: Hello, Marley... She crouches down, gives him a kiss, rubs his back. And that's when we hear a small, birdlike chirp and the dog freezes. Where'd that come from? We hear the coo again and this time Marley lifts one paw the air like a bird dog, and points in the direction of t car seat that we now see sitting on the bed... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby in his high chair. Jenny sets a few cheerios on tray. Patrick picks them up and drops them, we follow the down... THE FLOOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To where Marley waits, eagerly vacuuming up the cereal. I continues to RAIN CHEERIOS and we then BOOM BACK UP and s that Patrick is now eight months old, laughing as he thro the cereal onto the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: They're still here. He looks up at their reflection in the window, not so sur

dialogues.text: Honey, don't go out there. JOHN

dialogues.text: As other lights come on, NEIGHBORS start to come out onto street. John runs to where we see THE TEENAGE GIRL NEXT D bent over, sobbing, in her driveway beside her car, drive door still open. John lets go of Marley and hurries to he GIRL

dialogues.text: He said not to scream or he'd stab me, but I screamed... And John sees the blood on her shirt. He takes hold of he JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny'll call her...

dialogues.text: Marley sniffs at the ground, growling more and more intensely. We hear SHOUTING, "He went that way" as severa neighbors take off running. Marley lifts his head and he, too, bolts into the night--- JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley! NO! But he's gone and John has to stay with the girl. We hear SIRENS as she slides down the car and sits down on the ground. John sits down beside her, holding onto her... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're gonna be alright, Lisa, the police are on the way... John looks off, wondering where Marley is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crime scene. Jenny, clutching the baby, stands on the p watching as an AMBULANCE pulls away. John, now in shorts a T-shirt, comes jogging up the walk. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find him anywhere. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should get in the car, drive around. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the keys... John's coming into the house when a police cruiser pulls the curb in front of the house. A POLICEMAN gets out of t driver's side, then opens the back and leads Marley out. bounds up the walk to the two of them who greet him... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?
126 CONTINUED: 126 OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him outside the 76 station on Radford. He had the guy cornered in the men's room. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you caught the guy? OFFICER NO-- (INDICATES MARLEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jig caught the guy. He also gnawed the barrel of my shotgun, and ate half my radio mic. They look at Marley wagging his tail, panting. OFFICER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, the neighbors all said he belonged here, but none of them wanted to drive him, so... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for bringing him home. OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva dog. John nods as The Officer heads back to his car. Jenny crouches down and gives Marley a big hug and a back rub.. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An upscale, newer money neighborhood. An OPEN HOUSE sign front. John pulls up. He opens the door, holds up a hand Marley who sits in the back-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay. --and starts to unhook Patrick from his car seat. Marley bolts out of the car and heads straight for the house... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REALTOR is showing a COUPLE around the large, empty, ne house. She points out the designer kitchen that looks out onto the patio and pool, a huge yellow lab now leaping in A moment later, we see John, clutching Patrick, enter the backyard, try to haul Marley out of the pool. He gives up heads for the house, opens the back door and peers inside JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. The Realtor smiles awkwardly at him. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see a set-up, please? REALTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. (looks at the baby) First home? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we live up in West Palm, over on Churchill? REALTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh. Well, I think you'd find this neighborhood to be quite a pleasant change. And now Marley bolts past him into the house, tracking we footprints all over the floor, jumps up onto the REALTOR. REALTOR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... my... hello... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who's dog is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters, carrying Patrick, supplies to fix the screen JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny? A wet Marley bounds into the house, heads for the back. J follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is crouched on the floor when John appears in doorway. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You alright? She stands up, smiles the best she can. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Where you guys been? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna show you something. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands her the set up) A house. (before she can react) It's a little pricey, but I think we can do it. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I know we've talked about it, but I'm not sure this is the right time. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when would the right time be, Jen? After one of us gets stabbed in the driveway? JENNY JOHN-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, honey, we're cramped in here. This was supposed to be our three-year house, remember? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but we can't afford to buy a new one. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, we can. With both our salaries-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that... I don't think I'm gonna be able to keep working. (MORE)
130 130 CONTINUED: JENNY (CONT'D) (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Are you sure? She steps away, revealing the counter where FOUR PREGNANC TESTS are lined up, all with the same result: Positive. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits with Sebastian at his desk. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already? I mean, how old's the one you got? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About eight months. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Haven't you heard of birth control? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, sometimes it doesn't work. You know what else doesn't work? The one about how "A dog will stop your wife's biological clock." SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not the one, keeps getting her pregnant. John gives him a look, sees Arnie heading into his office takes a breath and gets to his feet. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish me luck. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he'll give you the raise. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always gives me one. John just shakes his head, starts for Arnie's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits across from Arnie. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I do this, why are you worth it? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm doing a good job? ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since I took over, the column has doubled in readership... ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are doing a good job. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why not make it permanent? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like forever? ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the word "forever" means. Yes. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you know how many yo yo's in the other room would kill to have their own column? You took a piece of crap About Towner and turned it into something fresh. (SITS BACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to break it to you, son, but you're a good columnist. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had this idea about myself, you know, that I was a reporter. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well sometimes life comes up with a better idea. Tell you what. You make it a daily column and I'll double your salary. How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOVING VAN is parked out front. Marley runs back and fo as the MOVERS load up the truck, John and and a very preg Jenny supervising. John sees LISA, the girl next door, as comes out of her house. She walks over to him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lisa. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: well, I don't blame you. I just thought I'd come over and say-- But Marley comes running over and she crouches down to gr him. She hugs him a while... LISA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you. John watches as she holds on to him a bit longer, thankin him as well. John turns away, starts back for the van to give her a moment. She stands up. LISA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you moving to? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boca. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... what? LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just... never pictured, you know, a guy like you moving to Boca. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy like me? LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know, young, cool, whatever.
133 CONTINUED: 133 JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think I'm young and cool. And you're not just saying that because I saved your life? LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, a paramedic named Josh saved my life. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, take care, Lisa. Oh, WAIT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into a moving box, pulls out a chewed-up black Converse. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe this belongs to you. LISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I'll have to chew up the other one to make it match. (extends her hand) Have fun down there. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's gonna be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still beautiful, but now we hear the sound of a BABY WAIL OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the elegant kitchen we saw, bare and uninhabited, several scenes ago. Now it's full of the clutter of the Grogans' life. The new baby, CONOR is screaming. We follo Jenny through the new house asshetries to soothe him. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, honey. Come on. John follows now... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he wet? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And I can't get a burp out of him. I think it's colic.
135 CONTINUED: 135 JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to drive him? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do that every night. From the other room, we HEAR Patrick CRYING, "Mommy!" JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do the washer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sitting on the washer with his WAILING BABY. Not fun John looks to where Marley lies in the corner, watching. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is opening the cupboards, getting cereal and yogurt a bowl for Patrick. Jenny enters with a fussing Conor on shoulder... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take him? I just need a minute to myself. John takes the baby and instantly Conor starts crying lou JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens every time. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just need to spend more time with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John puts Conor on the changing table, unbuttons his ones checks his diaper. It's wet; he starts changing him. Cono cries throughout. Jenny enters. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, I'll do it.
138 138 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing it! It's fine! You tell me to spend more time with him, I do it, and then you take over because I'm not doing it right. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you changing him when you're mad. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not mad! He hears himself, lets her change the baby. She takes him sits down with him in a rocking chair, tries to nurse him JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conor, come on... Conor, please... She finally stops trying, rocks the chair, looks helpless at John. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's wrong with me. Mothers are supposed to be able to give their baby everything. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just colicky, Jen. He'll grow out of it. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's an idea, you stay here and I'll go to work while he grows out of it. He holds up his hands, what does he say to that. She look up at him a moment. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tired, alright? Go on. She then resumes trying to nurse the baby. He walks out o the room. She rocks back and forth, looks up with a dark expression as she hears his CAR START.

dialogues.speaker: ARNIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's post partum depression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits on a stool in front of'a portable SCREEN while pretty female PHOTOGRAPHER adjusts her lights. Arnie sits nearby on a desk watching the portrait... ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hormones are all on tilt and she's depressed. It happens. After my fourth kid was born, I'd wake up, find my wife just staring at me with a mallet in her hand. I thought she was gonna kill me in my sleep. I still do... (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get her the gift? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. That usually works. Arnie gets off the desk, says to the Photographer: ARNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Janice, make him look pretty. The man's an official columnist now. Arnie moves off and the photographer looks up from her ca and smiles at John. He smiles back. She keeps smiling... does he... she finally indicates his hair... PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a Barney sticker in your-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-- thanks. He rakes his fingers through his hair, grabs the offendin sticker, looks at her... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must look like hell... I don't think I've had a full night sleep in two months. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stress?
139 CONTINUED: 139 JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids. I got one with colic, and another, can't make it through the night without coming into my room every two hours. PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you're holding up great. You look cute. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? PHOTOGRAPHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like a cute, exhausted Dad. It's adorable. John just nods stupidly, the dagger so deep in his heart, he'll never reach it. She smiles at him. PHOTOGRAPHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certainly look a lot better than Jerry ever looked. I tried to get him to take a new picture, but he liked the one they took the day he started the column, nineteen years ago. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen years, huh... And just when he thought one dagger was brutal enough, hi expression goes really pensive. And on that look, we see FLASH as she takes his picture and go right to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pulls into his driveway, turns off the car and just there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John looks at the house... the windows all lit up. Ins Jenny moves about with the baby over her shoulder as Patr chases Marley around the room. John sits in the car, unab to move, just watching the chaos in the window. Marley jumps up against the glass, stands on his hind leg paws to the window and looks out. He barks and now Jenny comes up behind him, hauls him off the window and now see John sitting in the car. She gives him a look that says "What're you doing? Get in here!" John quickly gets out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jenny eat dinner in exhausted silence. Patrick throws his food on the floor where a happy Marley waits. Conor starts crying O.S. and Jenny gets up like a robot. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him. John leaves the room. Jenny sits there. 143 INT. JOHN & JENNY'S BEDROOM - NIGHT 143 John and Jenny are in bed asleep. Patrick comes into thei room. PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? Jenny wakes up on autopilot. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey, let's go back to bed. She leads him out of the room. And a second later Conor starts crying. John lies there a moment, then gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the doorway, Jenny, her back to us, gently bounce Conor on her shoulder. John moves into FRAME... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: She's crying, her back to John who's now in the b.g. A moment, then... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John comes into the kitchen just as Jenny takes a chewed of "Good-night, Moon" from Marley's mouth... JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ruined it! Bad dog! She leaves the room and John looks at the dog.
145 145 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just had to eat the book? What, have you got some kind of death wish? I'm telling you, you better chill, or she'll kill you. Right after she kills me. 146

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny loads up the back of the car with bags of grocer Patrick, sitting in the cart, looks off and points-- PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Jenny turns and sees A BUS, with John's picture on the si an advertisement for his column. She watches it pass. PATRICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy! JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I see him. And she goes back to loading the car. 147

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny gently sets a sleeping Conor in his crib. She quietly backs out of the room and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she peers in on Patrick, also napping in his room. 149 INT. JOHN & JENNY'S BEDROOM - DAY 149 As Jenny comes in, Marley following and sits down heavily the bed. She looks at Marley as he lays down beside the b JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay. She now lays down and closes her eyes. A moment of peace. And then, somewhere in the distance we hear a faint BEEP BEEP as some truck backs up. Marley lifts his head, perks his ears and listens. Please don't bark, dog. Please don' bark. BEEP BEEP- And Marley BARKS, bolts out of the room. Jenny opens her eyes with a start as Marley runs barking through the house, we hear something CRASH and break O.S.
149 149 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Conor's crying. 150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marley jumps up against the window and peers out. Jenn comes into the room, sees a lamp on its side, a cushion t open where Marley now stands. she grabs him by the collar JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do this?! Why do you wreck everything! Why?!! She hauls her hand back to hit him, but hesitates, and ju shoves him away from her and storms into the other room f Conor. 151

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John pulls up, gets out of his car. We hear Marley barking in the garage. 152

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John comes in, sees Jenny sitting there on the couch. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's Marley out in the-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that dog out of here. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll take him out. She looks up at him. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get him out of here and keep him out of here. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, John. I want him gone. I want him gone for good. 153

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEES THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad John posts a "DOG FOR SALE" sign. A CO-WORKER sign and smiles.
153 153 CONTINUED: CO-WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the dog in your column? Obed ience school? Necklace in the poop? Good luck. PUTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John watches the guy walk off, scribbles a new it up. This one reads "E F D TO GOOD HOME." comes up to John. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You giving up the dog? i thought yo u loved that thing. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny wants him out. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's harsh, man. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what else to do. She's really unhappy. Maybe the dog is just one too many things. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all unhappy. Trust me. Well... who knows? Maybe you'll get lucky and nobody'll want him. John just nods, thinks about that. Sebastian glances arou then takes John aside. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, there's something I gotta tell you. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving the paper. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gave Arnie my notice. John looks over at Arnie's office, the door's closed. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not too happy about it. He called me an ungrateful quizzling and threw a stapler at me. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going over to the Post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153 153 CONTINUED: (2) SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to New York. Sebastian smiles. John doesn't move. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gray Lady came courting last week. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times, I'm talking about the New York BUDDY-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you're talking about. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem happy for me. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm just in shock. I mean, I'm in Florida because of you. Woodward and Bernstein. Remember? That was the idea. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was the idea before you decided to be the Andy Rooney of South Florida. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't decide to be anything-- SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Boom. That hurts John. They stand there a moment, considering each other, then. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, you're happy doing your thing and I'm not trying to piss on that. I mean it, you're good at it. I just wanted you to be the first to know. That's all. 154

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house where John and Jenny bought Marley. Lori, the breeder, looks at Marley, sitting in the front seat, shak her head sadly.
Marley & He Shooting Draft 155

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John posts some more flyers around the park. He drops flyer and Marley, walking beside him, starts to eat it... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart boy. 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "BROWARD COUNTY DOG RESCUE." A refuge for dogs. John fill out a form... JOHN THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh... Monday, then. Give us weekend. EMPLOYEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to you. John looks at the dogs in the back, all of them trying to his attention. 157

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is working at his desk when Arnie drops a few stacks letters down. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are all responses to the column you wrote last week. John thinks a moment... ARNIE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One where you said you may have to give the dog away. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the letters) Oh. I assume they all want me to keep him. ARNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're all saying they'd take him. Arnie moves on and John stares at the letters. 158

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John walks around the yard picking up Marley's various to putting them into a box.
158 CONTINUED: 158

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley follows, jumping up, trying to get the toys back o of the box. John grabs a frisbee, looks at the dog. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't lo any more of these, ok ay? Because they s e 're not gonna keep getting you more, and I won't be there to look for them... He looks at Marley standing there wagging his tail. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be fine, alright. I'll just be different. Maybe e it'll, b better, nobody poking your yanking your tail. Who knows? Could be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's been watching. She stands there thoughtfully as J puts the frisbee in the box and resumes the hunt for the of Marley's stuff, the dog following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's sitting on the bed waiting as John comes in. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all packed up. Patrick will want to say good-bye, but Conor's too young TO-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Three days ago, you were pretty clear-- JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but you can't do it. I won't let you. You can't give away Marley. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, wait. I'm lost. You told me you didn't want him around. What's happened? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that you would have done something like that, for me, that you love me that much... (MORE)

dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You're the comic voice of South Florida's middle class. You're a national treasure. Well, a regional treasure. Municipal treasure, for sure. You're just a little burned out. Why don't you take a coupweeks off? Consider it my birthday present. 168

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at John comes into the kitchen - without Marley. him with concern... he start out of the room. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just out exploring. You know how much he likes the woods. PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get in the car, maybe drive OVER TO--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sees something) Jenny.
