dialogues.text: John and Jenny run to'a tree at the edge of the property. Marley lies on the ground, in a hollow, hidden from view the hill above. His belly is swollen, his face drawn. It' clear he's very ill. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, boy, it's okay... 197

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands with DR. PLATT, a female vet. Marley lies on floor in a dog bed, an IV is going into his paw.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: He's on an IV for fluids and a sedative. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: His stomach twisted. He ate or drank something quickly, took in a lot of air and his stomach flipped. I got a tube down which let out some of the gas. I think i untwisted it. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's okay...

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: For now. But once this happens, it almost always happens again. And if it does, there's not gonna be anything I can do. He's too old for that kind of surgery. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't happen again?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: More than likely, it will. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if it doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: I just think you should prepare yourself that he might not make it through the night. (MORE)
197 197 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe one percent of dogs ever survive THIS-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One percent? What's that number based on?

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: Mr. Grogan-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what it's based on: regular dogs. (getting worked up) Lady, we are so far from 'regular", you have no idea. (INDICATES MARLEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy here... He once ate an entire answering machine, and digested it. Then went back and ate the phone for dessert. So don't give me numbers like "one percent," because you don't know him. But I do, and I'll see him in the morning. We TRACK WITH JOHN as he storms out of the exam room, wal down the hall, goes through waiting room, then he PASSES as he goes out into the dark parking lot, walks to his ca and stops. We stay BEHIND HIM as he leans with one hand on his car, doesn't move. 198

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's sitting at the table looking through a thick albu when John comes in. She looks up at him expectantly. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just gonna have to wait and see. If he makes it through the night, I think we'll be alright. He notices the album. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you looking at? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your old columns. He's in a lot of 'em.
198 198 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John rotates the album for a better look. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved these? JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every one. He looks up at her. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even on the crappiest day, when the boys were driving me nuts and the laundry wasn't done and a hundred other things were hard, I knew I had this. (taps the book) Five minutes of you. Sometimes they were funny and sometimes they were sad, or silly or whatever, but they were all you. And for those five minutes, you made me feel better. She gets up, comes over to him, leans down and kisses his head. Then, as she starts out... JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should read them. They're pretty great. 199

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun just coming up. We hear A PHONE RING OVER. 200

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John, his head on the table, asleep, pops up at the so of the ring and grabs the phone. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (listens, then) Alright. Thank you. He hangs up, sees Jenny now standing in the doorway, tyin her robe, looking at him anxiously. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming home. 201

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John pulls up. He gets out of the SUV, walks around an opens the back window and now Marley sits up into view.
201 201 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: COLLEEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Marley's back! John opens the tail gate just as the kids come rushing on the porch, Marley's tail wagging as he's lifted out of th car and set on the ground, the kids now surrounding him.. 202

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loft. Downtown. Full of unpacked boxes. A mattress on the floor. Expensive electronics sit atop their cartons. John follows Sebastian on a "tour." JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place. How long you been here? SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years, little more. Sebastian sees John looking at all of the unpacked boxes. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in and out of town so much I really haven't had a chance to settle in. I hired a decorator, but she and I got into a thing and it got messy-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I still got one more interview to do. A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian opens the fridge revealing nothing but beer and hunk of Parmesan. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the piece again? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: U.N.
dialogues.text: SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, you told me that. So you're down in Philly now, huh? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside. More space for the kids.
202 202 CONTINUED: SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta you got, five now? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. Here's a picture of everybody... John pulls a photo from his wallet, hands it to Sebastian SEBASTIAN (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's holding up. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores the callowness) Yeah, she's great. And that's Colleen our youngest... SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the ladybug get-up? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at the memory) Oh, yeah, that's a funny story. She had done this pageant at her preschool two weeks before, but she didn't wanna take off the costume, plus Marley went ballistic for the antenna which is why it looks like he's trying to eat her head. SEBASTIAN (FLAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that is funny. (returns the photo) So I was thinking later on maybe Thai? There's this new place in the meat Packing District. How's that sound? Be just like old times. John stands there a moment, feeling the distance between them. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well, actually I'm headed back home later today. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I should probably get going...
202 202 CONTINUED: (2) SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. (awkward Man-pat hug) Good seeing you, man. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For sure. SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking him out) Oh, hey, be sure to check out the Delegates Lounge at the U.N... Great Mojitos, really hot interpreters. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip. And John goes out the door. Sebastian takes out his blackberry, dials... SEBASTIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Sea-bass. What're you up to tonight? (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. No, that's cool. Another time then. He hangs up, stands there in the middle of his big, empty apartment a moment. He then dials another number. SEBASTIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Sea-bass. What's going on? 203

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a cab pulls away and John carries his suitcase up onto porch. 204

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters the house, sets down his suitcase. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody home? He sees a note ("PICKING UP THE KIDS. J"), and peers into THE KITCHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Marley is up on his hind legs, eating something off counter. John puts his keys down, but Marley doesn't reac John sneaks up behind him. Marley keeps eating the grille cheese sandwich off the plate...
204 204 CONTINUED: JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley? Hey, boy. Marley looks up briefly as if he heard something, but the returns to eating. John is right behind him. John reaches out and touches Marley, and Marley jumps, totally guilty. Then he turns and greets John. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, boy? You didn't hear me? Huh? He looks at the dog a moment, thoughtful, then... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a walk. 205

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As John walks Marley off leash up a hill. At one point, J has to stop and wait for Marley to catch up. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, boy, just a little further to the top... Marley comes up, panting, eyes wet and happy. John looks him, can see how tired he is. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, this is a good spot right here. John looks out at the valley below, settles down onto the damp earth beside Marley. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just sit for a while. The two of them sit there, looking out at the beautiful countryside below. John strokes Marley for a moment. Look at the grey hair, the tired eyes that now look back at hi JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. So... you're gonna tell me, right? When it's time? Because I don't wanna make that decision on my own. So you just let me know when you're ready, okay? Marley rests his chin on John's arm.
205 205 CONTINUED: JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. 206

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is at the top of the stairs. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marley? (turns to John) Have you seen him? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not up here. 207

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Jenny find Marley lying peacefully in front of t dying fire. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I could move his bed down here. John sits down beside Marley. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. He's always slept with us. Now he can't even make it upstairs. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks pretty comfortable to me. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go get his bed. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jen? why don't you grab a blanket for me, too. She nods, starts back up the stairs. John grabs a pillow from the couch and lays down beside Marley. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a good spot. I may never sleep upstairs again.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Scooch over. He looks up and see that Jenny's brought a blanket. She l down with them. John puts his arm around them both. Marley's tail begins gently pounding the floor.
207 207 CONTINUED: JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like old times. THUMP. THUMP. 208

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits across from his editor. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be twice a week. Six hundred words. EDITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's the subject? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday stuff. The stuff we all go through. But funnier. EDITOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. I thought you came here to be a reporter. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, but I think we both know that isn't me. I'm a columnist. A good one. A SECRETARY sticks her head in the office... SECRETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John-- your wife's on the phone. She says it's important... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there. (to the editor) Think about it. 209

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny on the phone, looking out into the backyard. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get him back inside. He's lying out there in cold... and he won't move... 210

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon. John's car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and Patrick are sitting on the floor. Marley is lyi on the dining room floor, breathing heavily. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick came home and we got him here. Dr. Platt said if he's comfortable, leave him here for a while and see. But he's no better. John kneels down by Marley, who looks at him but doesn't his tail or lick his hand. He runs his hand over his coat then over his stomach, the dog flinches. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking him in. The kids all come into the room, Colleen carrying a stuff sheep. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he sick again? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he is, honey. But I'm going to take him to the hospital and they'll try to make him better. Conor bends down, nuzzles Marley's face. CONOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get better, Mar. COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take Lamby, okay? (she puts the stuffed animal next to him) But don't chew her other ear off. Patrick leans down, hugs Marley tightly and whispers righ HIS EAR: PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. When he looks up at his father, John can see that Patrick crying, that he knows what the other two don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John lifts Marley out of the car. Marley seems a little m alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 212 212 CONTINUED: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna walk? He sets him down gingerly. Hesitantly, Marley walks over the tree that countless dogs have peed on, sniffs it, the looks around. John looks around, too. It's a crisp spring night in Pennsylvania. Takes a breath... JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice night, huh? Marley looks around, then looks at John. There's somethin in his expression. John nods, knows what he's saying. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boy. (as Marley moves close) Okay. John, his heart breaking, bends down to carry Marley up t front steps of the clinic. 213

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands as Dr. Platt comes out...

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: I did everything that worked before. But no luck. There's still surgery, BUT HE'S-- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --not strong enough.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: There's blood in his stomach. The lining might be compromised. I don't know what we'll find if we go in there anyway. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a minute? I need to... I need to call my wife. 214

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's on his cell phone... JOHN (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. It's the stomach thing again. Nothing's working. They could do surgery, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny listens to John on the phone. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Jenny nods as tears come. They stay on the phone, quiet, just being with each other. Finally: JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, John. 216

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. 217

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John enters. Marley is on the table, zonked out. Dr. Plat has put a blanket on the cold metal table so Marley is wa

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: I'll give you some time. She goes. John stares down at Marley. Takes the stuffed lamb out of his pocket, places it under a paw. When John puts a hand on his flank, Marley's eyes flutter open. His tail THUMPS gently. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. He pets Marley's head, runs his hands all over Marley's b His coat, still shedding. His tail. He takes up each paw, each ear, remembering and memorizing at the same time. He leans down, puts his nose on Marley's neck and breathes h in. Then he goes around, squats down so he's on Marley's level. He looks into Marley's eyes. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you know all that stuff we always said about you? What a total pain you are? The world's worst dog? Well, don't you believe it. Don't believe it for a minute. You loved us, every day, no matter what. And that's a pretty amazing thing. (he leans in) (MORE)
217 CONTINUED: 217 JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know where you're going from here, but you remember this: You're a great dog, Marley. You are a great dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the BEDROOM, Jenny sits on the bed, the phone in her h waiting, we BEGIN PULLING AWAY DOWN THE HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Platt is in the room now. John, his hand on one of Marley's paws, kneels on the ground, looking at Marley, Marley lays on the table, looking right back at him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: He won't feel a thing. He'll just slip away. Are you ready? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Marley) We're ready. Dr. Platt inserts the needle into the I.V. and presses th plunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a pajama-clad Patrick slips a tape into the VCR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we now HOLD ON MARLEY'S EYES, slowly beginning to clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny sits vigil by the phone, we CONTINUE PULLING BAC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patrick sits alone in the dark living room, his face illuminated by the TV, as he watches SILENT IMAGES from Grogan family home videos: TWO-YEAR-OLD PATRICK rides on Marley's back through the h at 345 Churchill, young Marley's tail knocking over everything within range, toddler and dog both joyous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marley's eyes finally close. The CAMERA drifts to John hand, stroking Marley's side. Dr. Platt listens to Marley heart and says:

dialogues.speaker: DR. PLATT
dialogues.text: He's gone. FROM ABOVE, the dog on the table, the doctor discreetly g to the side, and John laying his head next to Marley and putting his arms around him as we now... 225

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the five Grogans walk across the-property. Colleen sit on John's shoulders. They reach a clearing where we see a small grave has been dug. John sets Colleen down... COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wrapped in his blanket... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he'll be warm. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want to read your letters? COLLEEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine is a picture. Of me and Marley. And grasshoppers. And ice cream. Mommy wrote what I said. "Dear Marley. I will never forget you, forever." And those are kisses. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful, honey. He'll like it. Drop it in. Conor? Conor reads his piece of paper. CONOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Marley. I loved you all my life. I hope you like heaven and that there's lots to chew on. Your brother, Conor Richard Grogan." John puts his hand on Conor's shoulder as Conor drops in letter into the grave. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick? Do you want to say anything?     225 225 CONTINUED: PATRICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to give him something. Jenny reaches behind her neck and unclasps the gold neckl John gave Jenny when she first got pregnant. JENNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little necklace has been on quite a journey. John smiles at her, remembering. So much shared history. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad gave this to me to celebrate the beginning of our family. But you know what? Our family had already begun. She looks into the grave, gently sets the necklace atop t blanket, lets her hand rest there a moment, then stands u JENNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Clearance Puppy. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John puts few big stones on top of the tamped-down earth. sits on his haunches beside the grave, looks up at the ho across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: All lit up. We see the kids sitting by the fire while Jen moves about the kitchen getting dinner ready. John sits there watching them. watching his family. The family that both he and Marley grew up in. He gives the fresh dirt a final, loving pat and then, as last bit of sun goes down, he stands up, and heads for ho FADE OUT
